greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 1 if x^2 + 1 = n * y^2 has infinitely many solutions in integers (x,y), otherwise a(n) = 0.
reference: H. Davenport, The Higher Arithmetic. Cambridge Univ. Press, 7th ed., 1999, table 1.
link: John Robertson, Solving the generalized Pell equation x^2-dy^2=N.
results.author: _Frank Ellermann_, Feb 25 2002
ext: More terms from Antonio G. Astudillo (afg_astudillo(AT)lycos.com), Mar 31 2003
